ai.summary: London LOOP Section 16 is a 27.2 km long, challenging leg of the London LOOP around Greater London, featuring varied terrain and mixed rural and urban sections. Best suited for experienced hikers with stamina and navigation skills.
ai.terrain_summary: Undulating mixed terrain including grassy paths, chalk tracks, woodland trails, fields, and occasional roadside walking. Expect gates and stiles, muddy sections after rain, and some urban pinch points. Navigation is straightforward on the official route but hedged sections can reduce visibility.
ai.safety_notes: Plan your day with a current map and route briefing. The path may cross busy roads and exposed sections; weather in the UK can change rapidly. Wear sturdy boots, carry enough water and food, and have warm layers. Start early to ensure daylight, carry a light source if finishing after dark, and bring a first aid kit. Have a charged phone and a backup navigation method, and let someone know your plans. Be mindful of livestock, private property, and potential closures.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
Map and compass or GPS device
Headlamp or flashlight with spare batteries
Snacks and a packed meal for a long day
Mobile phone and portable power bank
Rain cover or packable rain gear
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March–October) for best daylight and drier conditions; can be tackled in winter with careful planning and shorter daylight hours.
